concept.title: AMF support for multi-SIM with same MSISDN (Feature f20428-01)
concept.shortdesc: This feature supports more than one SUPI to register to the AMF by using the same MSISDN. The SUPIs are different for different SIM cards. This feature can be controlled with global parameter multiSimWithSameMsisdnSupport. By default, this feature is disabled.

conbody.p: This feature supports up to five UEs to share the same MSISDN. These changes affect the lawful interception, call trace and event exposure functions as follows:

ul.li: The LI targets are selected based on multiple UE entries that are using the same MSISDN. In addition, all the UE entries are treated as LI targets, if the MSISDN is in the LI target list.
The AMF performs call traces on all UEs that the CT job is keyed by the MSISDN and there are multiple UEs/SUPIs mapped to the MSISDN.
The AMF rejects Event Exposure requests if the request has only the MSISDN without the IMSI.
